title: Problem-Based Online Education for Serious Game Design and Development

context.prior_knowledge: Game development fundamentals, instructional design principles, and understanding of social problem-solving
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented program using VR/simulations in a BYOD environment, aimed at strengthening adult learners' problem-solving skills for societal issues.

learning_goals: Learners can create educational design documents for serious games addressing social issues by applying game-based learning theories (e.g., ARCS model, constructivism)
Learners can develop serious game prototypes containing at least five interactive elements in VR/simulation environments using Unity or Unreal Engine
Learners can design a three-level (reaction, learning, behavior) evaluation system to assess the educational effectiveness of developed games based on the Kirkpatrick model

resources: Serious games database for case analysis

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
